ITEM.text: is an example of creating and managing lists of pointers

ITEM.name: Using Lists of Values
ITEM.text: is an example of creating and managing lists of values

ITEM.name: Using Sets
ITEM.text: is an example of creating and managing sets of CATString instances

ITEM.name: Using Lists of Integers
ITEM.text: is an example of creating and managing one or several lists of simple types

ITEM.name: Using Hash Tables
ITEM.text: is an example of creating and managing hash tables

ITEM.name: Lists of Pointers
ITEM.text: is the reference for managing pointers to instances of the same class.

ITEM.name: The Callback Mechanism
ITEM.text: describes how to make objects collaborate

ITEM.name: The Send/Receive Communication Protocol
ITEM.text: explains how to send notifications from commands to commands

ITEM.name: Callback versus Send/Receive
ITEM.text: shows how to create and use a notification depending on the mechanism

ITEM.name: Using Callbacks
ITEM.text: is an example of making objects collaborate

ITEM.name: Creating a Backbone Simple Message
ITEM.text: is an example of creating a message that does not convey any data

ITEM.name: Creating a Backbone Data Message
ITEM.text: is an example of creating a message that conveys data

ITEM.name: Sending a Backbone Simple Message to an Application
ITEM.text: is an example of using the backbone to send a message without data

ITEM.name: Sending a Backbone Data Message to an Application
ITEM.text: is an example of using the backbone to send a message with data.

ITEM.name: Managing Errors Using HRESULT
ITEM.text: describes how to create, analyze, enrich, and react to errors using HRESULT

ITEM.name: Managing Errors Using Exceptions
ITEM.text: explains how to create, analyze, enrich, and react to errors using exceptions

ITEM.name: Using an Error Class with HRESULTs or Exceptions
ITEM.text: shows how to associate information with errors

ITEM.name: Creating and Using Errors
ITEM.text: is an example of informing your clients when your program fails
